name: Chicken Teriyaki
description: Learn how to cook classic Chicken Teriyaki at home in less than 20 minutes using authentic Japanese cooking methods. You‚Äòll love the seared and juicy chicken thighs glazed in an easy and flavorful homemade sauce. No bottled teriyaki sauce needed!

Let's cook EASY + AUTHENTIC Japanese recipes at home!
Konnichiwa! I'm Nami, the creator of the Just One Cookbook website and cooking blog. I am glad that you are here with me. Here and on JustOneCookbook.com, you can find over 1,200 recipes, cooking tips, step-by-step instructions, ingredients, and shopping guides focused on Japanese cuisine.

I'm a native Japanese, born and raised in Yokohama, Japan, and now live in San Francisco, California, with my husband Mr. JOC, two high school kids, and a dog named Miso. I also wrote three Japanese cookbooks, where I share popular recipes like Oyakodon, Tamagoyaki, Chawanmushi, Sushi, Okonomiyaki, Mochi Ice Cream, Gyoza, Ramen, and more!

recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp neutral oil ((for cooking the chicken))

recipeInstructions.text: In Japan, we use boneless,¬†skin-on¬†chicken thighs for this dish because the flavorful skin provides a protective layer, keeps the meat juicy, and helps the delicious glaze adhere to the chicken. Thighs are more forgiving to cook than chicken breasts, too. Read more about it in the blog post above.For this recipe, I focus on skinless and boneless thighs since that‚Äòs how they‚Äòre commonly sold in the US. However, if you have the chance, I encourage you to try my skin-on recipe at the end of the instructions below.
recipeInstructions.name: In Japan, we use boneless,¬†skin-on¬†chicken thighs for this dish because the flavorful skin provides a protective layer, keeps the meat juicy, and helps the delicious glaze adhere to the chicken. Thighs are more forgiving to cook than chicken breasts, too. Read more about it in the blog post above.For this recipe, I focus on skinless and boneless thighs since that‚Äòs how they‚Äòre commonly sold in the US. However, if you have the chance, I encourage you to try my skin-on recipe at the end of the instructions below.

itemListElement.text: In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the sauce ingredients: 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 Tbsp mirin, 2 Tbsp sake, and 1 Tbsp sugar.
itemListElement.name: In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine the sauce ingredients: 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 Tbsp mirin, 2 Tbsp sake, and 1 Tbsp sugar.

itemListElement.text: Microwave the sauce until hot. Mix well to dissolve the sugar and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Microwave the sauce until hot. Mix well to dissolve the sugar and set aside.

itemListElement.text: Place ¬æ‚Äì1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs smooth side down on a cutting board. Now, use the scoring method to create an even thickness so the thighs cook evenly. First, cut slits across the meat every ¬Ω inch (1.3 cm) without slicing all the way through. Note: Do not use a meat mallet/tenderizer for this important step, as you may damage the thighs.
itemListElement.name: Place ¬æ‚Äì1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs smooth side down on a cutting board. Now, use the scoring method to create an even thickness so the thighs cook evenly. First, cut slits across the meat every ¬Ω inch (1.3 cm) without slicing all the way through. Note: Do not use a meat mallet/tenderizer for this important step, as you may damage the thighs.

itemListElement.text: Make deeper slits on the chicken‚Äòs thick parts and skip scoring the thin parts. After each cut, press open and flatten the meat with your fingers. In the below images, you can see how I scored (left) and flattened (right) one piece. Once you finish scoring, check again to make sure the thigh has an even thickness. Repeat with the rest of the thighs.
itemListElement.name: Make deeper slits on the chicken‚Äòs thick parts and skip scoring the thin parts. After each cut, press open and flatten the meat with your fingers. In the below images, you can see how I scored (left) and flattened (right) one piece. Once you finish scoring, check again to make sure the thigh has an even thickness. Repeat with the rest of the thighs.

itemListElement.text: Lightly season the chicken pieces with ‚Öõ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and ‚Öõ tsp freshly ground black pepper.
itemListElement.name: Lightly season the chicken pieces with ‚Öõ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and ‚Öõ tsp freshly ground black pepper.

itemListElement.text: Heat a large frying pan over medium to medium-high heat. When the pan is hot, add 1 Tbsp neutral oil. When the oil is hot, place the chicken smooth side down in the pan. Note: The bottom side will be the presentation side.
itemListElement.name: Heat a large frying pan over medium to medium-high heat. When the pan is hot, add 1 Tbsp neutral oil. When the oil is hot, place the chicken smooth side down in the pan. Note: The bottom side will be the presentation side.

itemListElement.text: Cook the chicken for 5 minutes (set a timer). Immediately, press down hard on the chicken with a spatula for 5‚Äì10 seconds to give the presentation side a nice sear. The right image below shows what the chicken looks like after 5 minutes of cooking; please adjust the time based on your stove and cookware.
itemListElement.name: Cook the chicken for 5 minutes (set a timer). Immediately, press down hard on the chicken with a spatula for 5‚Äì10 seconds to give the presentation side a nice sear. The right image below shows what the chicken looks like after 5 minutes of cooking; please adjust the time based on your stove and cookware.

itemListElement.text: Flip over the chicken. Immediately press it down again with the spatula for 5‚Äì10 seconds.
itemListElement.name: Flip over the chicken. Immediately press it down again with the spatula for 5‚Äì10 seconds.

itemListElement.text: Switch to low heat, then cover with a lid and steam the chicken for 3 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Switch to low heat, then cover with a lid and steam the chicken for 3 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Open the lid. Use a paper towel to wipe the excess grease and protein from the pan. This helps create a more transparent sauce.
itemListElement.name: Open the lid. Use a paper towel to wipe the excess grease and protein from the pan. This helps create a more transparent sauce.

itemListElement.text: Now, increase the stove‚Äòs heat to medium and add the teriyaki sauce to the pan. Tilt the pan and frequently spoon the sauce over the chicken.¬†
itemListElement.name: Now, increase the stove‚Äòs heat to medium and add the teriyaki sauce to the pan. Tilt the pan and frequently spoon the sauce over the chicken.¬†

itemListElement.text: When the chicken is well coated with the sauce and cooked through, transfer it to a cutting board.
itemListElement.name: When the chicken is well coated with the sauce and cooked through, transfer it to a cutting board.

itemListElement.text: When the sauce is thick enough, transfer it to a bowl. Remember to stop cooking while the sauce is slightly thin because the residual heat will continue to thicken the sauce. If you‚Äòd like it thicker, reduce the sauce for 2‚Äì3 more minutes.
itemListElement.name: When the sauce is thick enough, transfer it to a bowl. Remember to stop cooking while the sauce is slightly thin because the residual heat will continue to thicken the sauce. If you‚Äòd like it thicker, reduce the sauce for 2‚Äì3 more minutes.

itemListElement.text: Slice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.¬†Transfer them to a ceramic plate. Sear with a kitchen butane torch to enhance the flavor. You can also use a broiler in the oven.
itemListElement.name: Slice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.¬†Transfer them to a ceramic plate. Sear with a kitchen butane torch to enhance the flavor. You can also use a broiler in the oven.

itemListElement.text: Serve on a plate with the sauce drizzled on top. You can also serve it over steamed rice with the sauce drizzled on top, as I did here. I also served green salad and tomato wedges on the side.
itemListElement.name: Serve on a plate with the sauce drizzled on top. You can also serve it over steamed rice with the sauce drizzled on top, as I did here. I also served green salad and tomato wedges on the side.

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for 3 days or in the freezer for a month.
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for 3 days or in the freezer for a month.

itemListElement.text: If your ¬æ‚Äì1 lb skin-on chicken thighs are bone-in, ask your butcher to remove the bone or you can debone them yourself. Place the thigh meat skin side down on a cutting board. To even the thickness, make slits on the meat every ¬Ω inch (1.3 cm) without cutting all the way through. Cut deeper slits on the thick parts and skip scoring the thin parts. As you score, press open the meat to flatten it. Once you finish scoring, check again to make sure the meat has an even thickness. Repeat with the rest of the thighs.
itemListElement.name: If your ¬æ‚Äì1 lb skin-on chicken thighs are bone-in, ask your butcher to remove the bone or you can debone them yourself. Place the thigh meat skin side down on a cutting board. To even the thickness, make slits on the meat every ¬Ω inch (1.3 cm) without cutting all the way through. Cut deeper slits on the thick parts and skip scoring the thin parts. As you score, press open the meat to flatten it. Once you finish scoring, check again to make sure the meat has an even thickness. Repeat with the rest of the thighs.

itemListElement.text: Place the thighs skin side down in a hot frying pan and cook using the same method as the recipe above.
itemListElement.name: Place the thighs skin side down in a hot frying pan and cook using the same method as the recipe above.

itemListElement.text: Slice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.¬†Transfer them to a ceramic plate. Sear with a kitchen butane torch to enhance the flavor. You can also use a broiler in the oven. Serve on a plate and drizzle the sauce on top.
itemListElement.name: Slice the chicken into bite-sized pieces.¬†Transfer them to a ceramic plate. Sear with a kitchen butane torch to enhance the flavor. You can also use a broiler in the oven. Serve on a plate and drizzle the sauce on top.

review.reviewBody: I made this for dinner and was amazed at how easy it was to make and how tasty it was! This teriyaki sauce recipe is so much better than any store bought teriyaki I've ever tried. I served this with rice and a salad that I topped with Nami's wafu dressing which is also delicious.

Recipe was straightforward to follow and result was delicious. Paired nicely with a simple salad of greens, cucumber and tomato with JOC homemade miso dressing. I used bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs that I de-boned myself. The skin-on is quite yummy, especially if you blister it a bit with a broiler at the end (I used my toaster oven on broiler setting). However, make sure to scale up the amount of chicken since the bones take up weight.

You have the best recipes. I don't even look anywhere else anymore. The tips and the insights are so great. Your recipes teach me how to cook and I enjoy the process. 
Chicken teriyaki was  made by my husband, so this time i did only the enjoying in the final product. Oishiiii :)
Very easy recipe and very tasty!

Wow! This recipe was SO quick and easy - we were so surprised how tasty it was.. will definitely be adding this to our weeknight meals, but could also definitely serve at dinner parties to impress guests! Thank you so much Nami san for providing so many fantastic recipes - we love trying them all üç±ü•ü

Awesome recipe! I made chicken teriyaki over the weekend, it surely was an practical and easy recipe. The only thing I did differently was I cooked more than 5 minutes to get all thigh well done although the skins were burnt a bit. then when I pressed the chicken, oil splattered every where. Overall, I do love this recipe a lot. Thank you so much.
Great recipe! Tasted great and fairly quick to make.
